definition: to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
ten/10
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
nine/9
settled/steady/stable

sentences.english: Eg:Book early if you want to be sure of a seat .
sentences.chinese: 要想十拿九穩有個座位，那就早訂座。

sentences.english: Government officials said the move shows the project is stable.
sentences.chinese: 政府官員稱上述行動顯示該項目已經十拿九穩。

sentences.english: Perhaps he considered himself a shoo-in.
sentences.chinese: 或許他認爲自己會十拿九穩。
當然，沒有任何事是十拿九穩的。

sentences.english: This time the opportunity presented what he fatuously termed to himself a "cinch."
sentences.chinese: 這一次出現的機會極爲難得，他滿以爲十拿九穩哩。

victory is in sight

impoverished/backward both economically and culturally

man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
to charge and break through enemy lines
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
economic difficulty
the critical moment/life and death crisis
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
